The 'Eighteenth United States Congress' was a meeting of the legislative branch
of the United States federal government, consisting of the United States Senate
and the United States House of Representatives. It met in Washington, D.C. from
March 4, 1823 to March 4, 1825, during the seventh and eighth years of James
Monroe's presidency. The apportionment of seats in the House of Representatives
was based on the Fourth Census of the United States in 1820. Both chambers had a
Democratic-Republican majority.
